title: Representing Matroids over the Reals is âˆƒâ„-complete
abstract:
Abstract
A matroid Mğ‘€M is an ordered pair (E,â„)ğ¸â„(E,\mathcal{I}), where Eğ¸E is a finite set called the ground set and a collection â„âŠ‚2Eâ„superscript2ğ¸\mathcal{I}\subset 2^{E} called the independent sets which satisfy the conditions:
(i) âˆ…âˆˆâ„â„\emptyset\in\mathcal{I}, (ii) Iâ€²âŠ‚Iâˆˆâ„superscriptğ¼â€²ğ¼â„I^{\prime}\subset I\in\mathcal{I} implies Iâ€²âˆˆâ„superscriptğ¼â€²â„I^{\prime}\in\mathcal{I}, and (iii)
I1,I2âˆˆâ„subscriptğ¼1subscriptğ¼2â„I_{1},I_{2}\in\mathcal{I} and |I1|<|I2|subscriptğ¼1subscriptğ¼2|I_{1}|<|I_{2}| implies that there is an eâˆˆI2ğ‘’subscriptğ¼2e\in I_{2} such that I1âˆª{e}âˆˆâ„subscriptğ¼1ğ‘’â„I_{1}\cup\{e\}\in\mathcal{I}.
The rank ğ—‹ğ—„â€‹(M)ğ—‹ğ—„ğ‘€{\sf rk}(M) of a matroid Mğ‘€M is the maximum size of an independent set.
We say that a matroid M=(E,â„)ğ‘€ğ¸â„M=(E,\mathcal{I}) is representable over the reals if there is a map
Ï†:Eâ†’â„ğ—‹ğ—„â€‹(M):ğœ‘â†’ğ¸superscriptâ„ğ—‹ğ—„ğ‘€\varphi\colon E\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{{\sf rk}(M)} such that Iâˆˆâ„ğ¼â„I\in\mathcal{I} if and only if
Ï†â€‹(I)ğœ‘ğ¼\varphi(I) forms a linearly independent set.
We study the problem of Matroid â„â„\mathbb{R}-Representability over the reals.
Given a matroidÂ Mğ‘€M, we ask whether there is a set of points in the Euclidean space
representingÂ Mğ‘€M.
We show that Matroid â„â„\mathbb{R}-Representability is âˆƒâ„â„\exists\mathbb{R}-complete, already for matroids of rankÂ 333.
The complexity class âˆƒâ„â„\exists\mathbb{R} can be defined as the family of algorithmic problems
that is polynomial-time equivalent to determining if a multivariate polynomial
with integer coefficients has a real root.
Our methods are similar to previous methods from the literature.
Yet, the result itself was never pointed out and there is
no proof readily available in the language of computer science.
